intro: Callista tropaeoliflora, commonly known as the golden star bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Callista tropaeoliflora thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
